comment.author: 17667180@N00
comment._content: This is a great shot. She looks so precariously perched there. Are floods common in the area?

comment.realname: Llyfrgell Genedlaethol Cymru  / The National Library of Wales
comment.author: 37199428@N06
comment._content: Hi Missnae - thanks, it's one of my favourites too, especially as we're lucky enough to know her name. The River Wye runs right through Builth Wells and there's a "Significant Risk" of flooding according to the Environment Agency - although I don't think there's been anything this bad recently!

comment.author: 66853325@N00
comment._content: Wonderful. It's actually quite timeless. I would have guessed at 1996 or something. -- Seen in a discussion of the group "Flickr Commons" (?)
